repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD)
            Emergency Recovery Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile focuses on Foot and
            Mouth Disease (FMD) Emergency Recovery Project in Uruguay.
            Uruguay's rural areas and overall economy were largely
            dependent on the livestock sector. The outbreak of FMD
            brought the rural areas and meat industry to a standstill,
            left an already financially embattled sector of producers
            facing increased costs, reduced revenues and uncertainty,
            and generated a major fiscal deficit. The Foot and Mouth
            Disease (FMD) Emergency Recovery Project supported a
            comprehensive set of inputs including vaccinations, training
            and awareness campaigns, and development of a tracking
            system that resulted in improved overall herd sanitary
            status and the development of modern and effective
            surveillance systems. Finally, FMD was eradicated in the
            country, rural economy was reactivated, and high quality
            beef exports were re-established. Uruguay positioned itself
            as a globally recognized model for effective food safety and
            surveillance through the establishment of their innovative
            Animal Tracking System.

repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Foot and Mouth Disease Emergency
            Recovery Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Foot and Mouth Disease
            Emergency Recovery Loan Project for Uruguay were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was moderate, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: emergency projects can be an effective
            tool to assist a country in controlling animal disease
            outbreaks, provided that conditions exist for a rapid Bank
            response in terms of project preparation and disbursement of
            funds. The design of an operation to address the economic
            emergency caused by a zoonotic event should be sufficiently
            flexible to combine short-term containment measures with
            support to strengthen surveillance and prevention systems in
            order to ensure long-term sustainability and minimize the
            risk of subsequent emergencies. The development of an
            individual animal tracking system represents an extremely
            effective mechanism to ensure adequate epidemiological
            surveillance and more rapid and effective containment in the
            event of an outbreak. The establishment of such system will
            be greatly facilitated by the previous existence of a
            reliable reporting system for farm livestock inventories and
            transactions. Enhanced individual tracking systems
            integrating health and geo-referenced data not only help to
            manage and mitigate disease outbreaks, but also can
            represent a valuable tool for on-farm herd management, as
            well as a source of strategic information on livestock
            production, logistics, marketing, processing, and food
            safety issues. Efficient, timely and uninterrupted operation
            of a Livestock Information System that involves animal
            tracking can be affected by the rules and regulations of the
            public service, particularly in terms of procurement
            procedures, flow of funds and remuneration levels for
            specialized staff and Information Technology (IT) operators.
            The achievement of a sustainable national disease free
            status should also incorporate transboundary disease
            surveillance and control with neighboring countries. Strong
            and continuous programs of education and training of the
            public and private veterinary services as well as farmers
            and public in general are required to update the evolving
            sanitary threats. The benefits, advantages and limitations
            of fast-track additional financing as an instrument to
            increase project funding should be carefully evaluated to
            determine if it represents the best option to expand and/or
            consolidate the outcomes of an emergency operation. If so, a
            more detailed design and appraisal will be required, in
            order to incorporate those elements not fully addressed in
            the original design.

repnme.cdata!:
Uruguay - Foot and Mouth Disease Emergency
            Recovery Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Foot and Mouth Disease (FMD)
            Emergency Recovery Project will provide technical, and
            financial support to the Government of Uruguay, to help
            contain, and mitigate the impact of the outbreak of FMD,
            through vaccination of the national herd, by strengthening
            the monitoring, and surveillance capacity in the country, to
            prevent future outbreaks, and, by identifying alternative
            markets for Uruguayan beef in the short-run, and restore the
            country's presence in the premium beef market in the
            long-run. The project will contribute in minimizing the
            impacts of the emergency, by defraying substantial,
            unexpected expenditures incurred in the implementation of
            the comprehensive containment, and recovery plan. Although
            the achievement of a rapid, sustainable reinstatement of a
            sanitary status, will enable the country regain access to
            premium export markets, and re-activate livestock
            production, risks associated with the deteriorating sanitary
            situation in the region, and the effectiveness of similar,
            neighboring countries' efforts, will require extreme
            caution to avoid recurrence of the current FMD outbreak. To
            this end, a regional task force has been created, to
            coordinate efforts, and ensure measures are being enforced
            region-wide, and, project activities will directly support
            these measures.
